content.text: The price of the car is \(28 240
The fuel tank in the new car has a capacity of 45 litres
This is \(72\%\) of the capacity of the fuel tank in her old car
Calculate the capacity of the fuel tank in her old car
Aadi buys a new car costing \(28 000
He pays for the car using a finance plan
Using this finance plan, Aadi pays a total of \(31 900 for the car
Calculate the deposit paid as a percentage of \(\) 28 000
A car travels \(64\mathrm{km}\) and uses 2.5 litres of fuel
It then travels \(128\mathrm{km}\) and uses 6 litres of fuel
Calculate the rate at which the car uses fuel during the whole journey
Give your answer in litres per \(100\mathrm{km}\)
At the start of 2021 the value of a car was \(\) 46 500
At the end of 2021 the value of the car was \(20\%\) less
At the end of 2022 the value of the car was \(15\%\) less than its value at the end of 2021
Calculate the value of the car at the end of 2022
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = x^{3} + 4x^{2} - 4\) for \(-4.5 \leqslant x \leqslant 1.5\)
Draw the tangent to the graph at the point (1, 1)
Use your tangent to estimate the gradient of the curve at the point (1, 1)
By drawing a suitable straight line on the grid, solve the equation \(x^{3} + 4x^{2} - x - 6 = 0\)
The table shows some values for \(y = x^{3} + 4x^{2} - 4.\)
This isosceles triangle has a perimeter of \(35.5 \mathrm{cm}\)
You must show all your working
You must show all your working
The angles of a quadrilateral are \(w^{\circ}\), \(x^{\circ}\), \(y^{\circ}\) and \(z^{\circ}\)
\(A, B, C\) and \(D\) are points on a circle
\(PQ\) is the tangent to the circle at \(A\)
Use the cumulative frequency diagram to find an estimate for
One of these motorists is picked at random
Find the probability that this motorist travels more than 1800 km
The cumulative frequency diagram shows information about the distance travelled by each of 80 motorists in a month
The distance around a racing track is 5.104 km
The time taken by a car to complete one lap of the track is 1 min 18 s
Calculate the average speed of the car
Show that there are 8 cars with a top speed in the interval \(120 < v \leqslant 160\)
Calculate an estimate of the mean top speed
You must show all your working
The top speed, \(v \mathrm{~km} / \mathrm{h}\), of each of 160 cars is recorded
Write each of the following in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\)
Give each answer in its simplest form
Use your answers to make **two** statements about the relationship between lines \(QP\) and \(CB\)
Show that angle \(ABD = 31.6^\circ\), correct to 1 decimal place
Find the shortest distance from \(A\) to \(BD\)
Trees are planted in the field
The number of trees planted is 1100 per hectare
Calculate the total number of trees planted in the field
The diagram shows a field, \(ABCD\) with \(B\) north of \(A\)
\(BD\) is a path across the field
A rectangle has an area of \(9400 \mathrm{~cm}^2\), correct to the nearest \(100 \mathrm{~cm}^2\)
The length of the rectangle is \(80 \mathrm{~cm}\), correct to the nearest \(10 \mathrm{~cm}\)
Calculate the upper bound of the width of the rectangle
Some are red, some are blue and 10 are yellow
One bead is picked at random from the bag
the first marble is black and the second marble is white
Another bag contains 5 green marbles, 6 white marbles and 4 black marbles
Meera picks 2 marbles at random from the bag, without replacement
Give your answer in the form \(ax^{2} + bx + c\)
Find the coordinates of the turning points of the graph of \(y = x^{3} - 9x^{2} - 48x.\)
You must show all your working
Determine whether each of the turning points is a maximum or a minimum
A curve has the equation \(y = x^{3} - 9x^{2} - 48x.\)
